info.title: Attestation REST API
info.description: Describes the interface for the per-tenant enclave service.

get.summary: Retrieves the OpenID Configuration data for the Azure Attestation Service
get.description:
Retrieves metadata about the attestation signing keys in use by the attestation
service

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.summary: Attest to an Azure Guest VM.
post.description:
Processes an Azure Guest TCG Log, producing an artifact. The type of artifact
produced is dependent upon attestation policy.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description:
Processes an OpenEnclave report , producing an artifact. The type of artifact
produced is dependent upon attestation policy.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.summary: Attest to an SEV SNP Virtual Machine.
post.description:
Processes a SEV SNP Boot chain. The type of artifact produced is dependent upon
attestation policy.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description:
Processes an SGX enclave quote, producing an artifact. The type of artifact
produced is dependent upon attestation policy.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.summary: Attest to a TDX Virtual Machine.
post.description:
Processes an TDX quote, producing an artifact. The type of artifact produced is
dependent upon attestation policy.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description:
Processes attestation evidence from a VBS enclave, producing an attestation
result. The attestation result produced is dependent upon the attestation
policy.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.summary: Retrieves the set of certificates used to express policy for the current tenant.
get.description: Retrieves the set of certificates used to express policy for the current tenant.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.summary:
Adds a new attestation policy certificate to the set of policy management
certificates.
post.description:
Adds a new attestation policy certificate to the set of policy management
certificates.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.summary:
Removes the specified policy management certificate. Note that the final policy
management certificate cannot be removed.
post.description:
Removes the specified policy management certificate. Note that the final policy
management certificate cannot be removed.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.summary: Retrieves the attestation signing keys in use by the attestation service
get.description: Retrieves metadata signing certificates in use by the attestation service

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.description: Retrieves the current policy for an attestation type.

parameters.name: attestationType
parameters.description: Specifies the trusted execution environment to be used to validate the evidence

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

put.summary: Sets the policy for a given attestation type.
put.description: Sets the policy for a given attestation type.

parameters.name: attestationType
parameters.description: Specifies the trusted execution environment to be used to validate the evidence

parameters.name: newAttestationPolicy
parameters.description: JWT Expressing the new policy whose body is a StoredAttestationPolicy object.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.summary:
Resets the attestation policy for the specified tenant and reverts to the
default policy.
post.description:
Resets the attestation policy for the specified tenant and reverts to the
default policy.

parameters.name: attestationType
parameters.description: Specifies the trusted execution environment to be used to validate the evidence

parameters.name: policyJws
parameters.description: JSON Web Signature with an empty policy document

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.summary:
Retrieves a list of all Azure supported baseline details for the a TEE type
along with an indication of which one is in enforced for the attestation
provider.
get.description:
Retrieves a list of all Azure supported baseline details for the a TEE type
along with an indication of which one is in enforced for the attestation
provider.

parameters.name: attestationType
parameters.description: Specifies the trusted execution environment to be used to validate the evidence

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

AddPolicyCertificateRequest.description: Request model for adding a policy certificate

policyCertificateToAdd.description: The certificate to add, as a string (e.g., PEM or JWK)

AttestAzureGuestRequest.description: Attestation request for Azure Guest Gen2 VMs

attestationInfo.description:
Attestation client information containing all artifacts required for Guest
Attestation.

AttestOpenEnclaveRequest.description: Attestation request for Intel SGX enclaves

report.description: OpenEnclave report from the enclave to be attested

runtimeData.description:
Runtime data provided by the enclave at the time of report generation. The MAA
will verify that the first 32 bytes of the report_data field of the quote
contains the SHA256 hash of the decoded "data" field of the runtime data.

initTimeData.description:
Base64Url encoded "InitTime data". The MAA will verify that the init data was
known to the enclave. Note that InitTimeData is invalid for CoffeeLake
processors.

draftPolicyForAttestation.description:
Attest against the provided draft policy. Note that the resulting token cannot
be validated.

nonce.description: Nonce for incoming request - emitted in the generated attestation token

AttestSevSnpVmRequest.description: Attestation request for AMD SEV SNP Virtual Machine

report.description:
Hardware rooted report of the virtual machine being attested along with the
signing certificate chain and optionally, additional endorsements

runtimeData.description:
Runtime data provided by the enclave at the time of report generation. The MAA
will verify that the run time data is known to the attestation target.

initTimeData.description:
Initialization data provided by the enclave at the time of report generation.
The MAA will verify that the init time data is known to the attestation target.

draftPolicyForAttestation.description:
Attest against the provided draft policy. Note that the resulting token cannot
be validated.

nonce.description: Nonce for incoming request - emitted in the generated attestation token

AttestSgxEnclaveRequest.description: Attestation request for Intel SGX enclaves

quote.description: Quote of the enclave to be attested

runtimeData.description:
Runtime data provided by the enclave at the time of quote generation. The MAA
will verify that the first 32 bytes of the report_data field of the quote
contains the SHA256 hash of the decoded "data" field of the runtime data.

initTimeData.description:
Initialization data provided when the enclave is created. MAA will verify that
the init data was known to the enclave. Note that InitTimeData is invalid for
CoffeeLake processors.

draftPolicyForAttestation.description:
Attest against the provided draft policy. Note that the resulting token cannot
be validated.

nonce.description: Nonce for incoming request - emitted in the generated attestation token

AttestTdxVmRequest.description: Attestation request for Intel TDX Virtual Machine

quote.description: Quote of the TDX virtual machine to be attested

runtimeData.description:
Runtime data provided by the enclave at the time of quote generation. The MAA
will verify that the first 32 bytes of the report_data field of the quote
contains the SHA256 hash of the decoded "data" field of the runtime data.

initTimeData.description:
Initialization data provided when the enclave is created. MAA will verify that
the init data was known to the enclave.

nonce.description: Nonce for incoming request - emitted in the generated attestation token

AttestationCertificateManagementBody.description: The body of the JWT used for the PolicyCertificates APIs

policyCertificate.description: RFC 7517 Json Web Key describing the certificate.

AttestationResponse.description: The result of an attestation operation

token.description: An RFC 7519 JSON Web Token, the body of which is an AttestationResult object.

AttestationResult.description:
A Microsoft Azure Attestation response token body - the body of a response
token issued by MAA

iss.description: The Principal who issued the token

iat.description:
The time at which the token was issued, in the number of seconds since
1970-01-0T00:00:00Z UTC

exp.description:
The expiration time after which the token is no longer valid, in the number of
seconds since 1970-01-0T00:00:00Z UTC

nbf.description:
The not before time before which the token cannot be considered valid, in the
number of seconds since 1970-01-0T00:00:00Z UTC

cnf.description: An RFC 7800 Proof of Possession Key

nonce.description: The Nonce input to the attestation request, if provided.

x-ms-ver.description: The Schema version of this structure. Current Value: 1.0

x-ms-policy-signer.description: The certificate used to sign the policy object, if specified.

x-ms-policy-hash.description: The SHA256 hash of the BASE64URL encoded policy text used for attestation

x-ms-sgx-is-debuggable.description: True if the enclave is debuggable, false otherwise

x-ms-sgx-product-id.description: The SGX Product ID for the enclave.

x-ms-sgx-mrenclave.description: The HEX encoded SGX MRENCLAVE value for the enclave.

x-ms-sgx-mrsigner.description: The HEX encoded SGX MRSIGNER value for the enclave.

x-ms-sgx-svn.description: The SGX SVN value for the enclave.

x-ms-sgx-ehd.description: A copy of the RuntimeData specified as an input to the attest call.

x-ms-sgx-collateral.description: The SGX SVN value for the enclave.

ver.description: DEPRECATED: Private Preview version of x-ms-ver claim.

is-debuggable.description: DEPRECATED: Private Preview version of x-ms-sgx-is-debuggable claim.

maa-attestationcollateral.description: DEPRECATED: Private Preview version of x-ms-sgx-collateral claim.

aas-ehd.description: DEPRECATED: Private Preview version of x-ms-sgx-ehd claim.

maa-ehd.description: DEPRECATED: Private Preview version of x-ms-sgx-ehd claim.

product-id.description: DEPRECATED: Private Preview version of x-ms-sgx-product-id

sgx-mrenclave.description: DEPRECATED: Private Preview version of x-ms-sgx-mrenclave.

sgx-mrsigner.description: DEPRECATED: Private Preview version of x-ms-sgx-mrsigner.

svn.description: DEPRECATED: Private Preview version of x-ms-sgx-svn.

tee.description: DEPRECATED: Private Preview version of x-ms-tee.

policy_signer.description: DEPRECATED: Private Preview version of x-ms-policy-signer

policy_hash.description: DEPRECATED: Private Preview version of x-ms-policy-hash

rp_data.description: DEPRECATED: Private Preview version of nonce

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Azure REST API guidelines - https://aka.ms/AzureRestApiGuidelines#handling-errors.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

values.name: IsPresent
values.description:
After the operation was performed, the certificate is in the set of
certificates.

values.name: IsAbsent
values.description:
After the operation was performed, the certificate is no longer present in the
set of certificates.

code.description:
An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be
consumed programmatically.

message.description:
A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for displaying in a
user interface.

DataType.description:
Specifies the type of the data encoded contained within the "data" field of a
"RuntimeData" or "InitTimeData" object

values.name: Binary
values.description: The field's content should be treated as binary and not interpreted by MAA.

values.name: JSON
values.description:
The field's content should be treated as UTF-8 JSON text that may be further
interpreted by MAA. Refer to RFC 8259 for a description of JSON serialization
standards for interoperability.

InitTimeData.description:
Initialization time data are a conduit for any configuration information that
is unknown when building the Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) and is defined
at TEE launch time. This data can be used with confidential container or VM
scenarios to capture configuration settings such as disk volume content,
network configuration, etc.

data.description:
Initialization time data are passed into the Trusted Execution Environment
(TEE) when it is created. For an Icelake SGX quote, the SHA256 hash of the
InitTimeData must match the lower 32 bytes of the quote's "config id"
attribute. For a SEV-SNP quote, the SHA256 hash of the InitTimeData must match
the quote's "host data" attribute.

dataType.description: The type of data contained within the "data" field

alg.description:
The "alg" (algorithm) parameter identifies the algorithm intended for
use with the key.  The values used should either be registered in the
IANA "JSON Web Signature and Encryption Algorithms" registry
established by [JWA] or be a value that contains a Collision-
Resistant Name.

crv.description: The "crv" (curve) parameter identifies the curve type

d.description: RSA private exponent or ECC private key

kid.description:
The "kid" (key ID) parameter is used to match a specific key.  This
is used, for instance, to choose among a set of keys within a JWK Set
during key rollover.  The structure of the "kid" value is
unspecified.  When "kid" values are used within a JWK Set, different
keys within the JWK Set SHOULD use distinct "kid" values.  (One
example in which different keys might use the same "kid" value is if
they have different "kty" (key type) values but are considered to be
equivalent alternatives by the application using them.)  The "kid"
value is a case-sensitive string.

kty.description:
The "kty" (key type) parameter identifies the cryptographic algorithm
family used with the key, such as "RSA" or "EC". "kty" values should
either be registered in the IANA "JSON Web Key Types" registry
established by [JWA] or be a value that contains a Collision-
Resistant Name.  The "kty" value is a case-sensitive string.

q.description: RSA secret prime, with p < q

use.description:
Use ("public key use") identifies the intended use of
the public key. The "use" parameter is employed to indicate whether
a public key is used for encrypting data or verifying the signature
on data. Values are commonly "sig" (signature) or "enc" (encryption).

x.description: X coordinate for the Elliptic Curve point

x5c.description:
The "x5c" (X.509 certificate chain) parameter contains a chain of one
or more PKIX certificates [RFC5280].  The certificate chain is
represented as a JSON array of certificate value strings.  Each
string in the array is a base64-encoded (Section 4 of [RFC4648] --
not base64url-encoded) DER [ITU.X690.1994] PKIX certificate value.
The PKIX certificate containing the key value MUST be the first
certificate.

y.description: Y coordinate for the Elliptic Curve point

keys.description:
The value of the "keys" parameter is an array of JWK values.  By
default, the order of the JWK values within the array does not imply
an order of preference among them, although applications of JWK Sets
can choose to assign a meaning to the order for their purposes, if
desired.

OpenIDConfigurationResponse.description: The response to the OpenID metadata description document API

response_types_supported.description: Types supported in the OpenID metadata API

id_token_signing_alg_values_supported.description: List of the supported signing algorithms

jwks_uri.description: The URI to retrieve the signing keys

claims_supported.description: Set of claims supported by the OpenID metadata endpoint

PolicyCertificatesModificationResult.description: The result of a policy certificate modification

x-ms-certificate-thumbprint.description:
Hex encoded SHA1 Hash of the binary representation certificate which was added
or removed

PolicyCertificatesModifyResponse.description: The response to an attestation policy management API

token.description:
An RFC7519 JSON Web Token structure whose body is a
PolicyCertificatesModificationResult object.

PolicyCertificatesResponse.description: The response to an attestation policy management API

token.description:
An RFC7519 JSON Web Token structure containing a PolicyCertificatesResults
object which contains the certificates used to validate policy changes

PolicyCertificatesResult.description: The result of a call to retrieve policy certificates.

x-ms-policy-certificates.description: SHA256 Hash of the binary representation certificate which was added or removed

values.name: Updated
values.description: The specified policy object was updated.

values.name: Removed
values.description: The specified policy object was removed.

PolicyResponse.description: The response to an attestation policy operation

token.description: An RFC7519 JSON Web Token structure whose body is an PolicyResult object.

PolicyResult.description: The result of a policy certificate modification

x-ms-policy-token-hash.description: The SHA256 hash of the policy object modified

x-ms-policy-signer.description: The certificate used to sign the policy object, if specified

x-ms-policy.description:
A JSON Web Token containing a StoredAttestationPolicy object with the
attestation policy

RemovePolicyCertificateRequest.description: Request model for removing a policy certificate

policyCertificateToRemove.description: The certificate to remove, as a string (e.g., PEM or JWK)

RuntimeData.description:
Runtime data are a conduit for any information defined by the Trusted Execution
Environment (TEE) when actually running.

data.description:
Runtime data are generated by the Trusted Execution Environment (TEE). For an
SGX quote (Coffeelake or Icelake), the SHA256 hash of the RuntimeData must
match the lower 32 bytes of the quote's "report data" attribute. For a SEV-SNP
quote, the SHA256 hash of the RuntimeData must match the quote's "report data"
attribute.

dataType.description: The type of data contained within the "data" field

SealedAttestationResponse.description: The sealed result of an attestation operation

token.description:
A sealed RFC 7519 JSON Web Token, the body of which is an AttestationResult
object.

AttestationPolicy.description: Policy text to set as a sequence of UTF-8 encoded octets.

TcbBaseline.description:
TEE specific Tcb baseline used in attestation, and baseline details including
baseline identifier, release date and minimum required software version

tcbIdentifier.description: The Tcb baseline Identifier used in attestation policy

tcbEvaluationDataNumber.description:
A monotonically increasing sequence number changed when Intel updates the
content of the TCB evaluation data set. SGX TEE specific property

tcbReleaseDate.description: Date and time when the Tcb is released. SGX TEE specific property

minimumPswLinuxVersion.description:
Minimum Linux PSW version required to support the corresponding Tcb baseline.
SGX TEE specific property

minimumPswWindowsVersion.description:
Minimum Windows PSW version required to support the corresponding Tcb baseline.
SGX TEE specific property

isSelectedTcb.description:
The corresponding Tcb baseline is set in attestation policy and is used in
attestation request if set to true

TcbBaselineResult.description:
A list of all Azure supported baseline details for the a TEE type along with an
indication of which one is in enforced for the attestation provider

tcbBaselines.description:
A list of all Azure supported baseline details for the a TEE type along with an
indication of which one is in enforced for the attestation provider

TpmAttestationRequest.description: Attestation request for Trusted Platform Module (TPM) attestation.

data.description: Protocol data containing artifacts for attestation.

TpmAttestationResponse.description: Attestation response for Trusted Platform Module (TPM) attestation.

data.description: Protocol data containing attestation service response.

Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.name: api-version
Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.description: The API version to use for this operation.
